instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_LID_R: What is SMC_LID_R? SMC_LID_R is the signal coming from the hall sensor that detects whether the laptop screen is closed or open. This must be high in order for SMC_LID to be high. SMC_LID has to be high for the machine to not fall asleep and for it to have a backlight..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short to GND <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
removed L6995 and short to gnd pin 2 (<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>)

Inject voltage with psu on pin 2 of L6995, 1V nothing heat

resistance to gnd pin 1 of Y2815 10,9 mohms and pin 3 9,9 mohms probably bad Mcp ?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short to GND <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Question is how much current was going in at 1V. You can inject up to 3V safely. At 1 Amp or more something must be getting hot.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short to GND <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Exactly thanks bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replaced board work but
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12,30V no charge battery and no Led driver button (tried good know), battery and charger good know.
<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> 10K
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_R</SIGNAL> 102K
17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 20ohms
Resistance to gnd pin 10/11 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 3,8K

Diode mod of J6950 :
pin 4 0,543
pin 5 2,762
pin6 0,561
pin 7,8,9 OL
